lesson.title: Your First Smart Contract Interaction
lesson.objective: Execute a transaction and understand gas mechanics

sections.content: Every DeFi action is a transaction. When you interact with a smart contract, you're calling a function on immutable code that executes exactly as written. No intermediaries, no permissions needed, no reversals possible.

Transactions cost gas - a fee paid to network validators for processing your request. Gas prices fluctuate with network demand. Learning to time transactions and set appropriate gas limits is a core DeFi skill.

content: Smart contracts are self-executing code on the blockchain
Gas = computational cost, paid in the network's native token
Failed transactions still cost gas (the computation was attempted)
Always verify the contract you're interacting with

questions.question: What is gas in blockchain transactions?
options: The fee paid for computational work

questions.question: If a transaction fails, what happens to the gas you paid?

unlockHint: Interact with any core protocol contract
nextSteps: You've executed your first transaction. EXPLORER requires 3 interactions.
Each interaction teaches you more about how DeFi contracts work.
